msContents.summary: F-75r: Gospel of John, arranged for the days of the week: Monday (1r), Saturday (14v), Tuesday (18v), Saturday (33r), Wednesday (40r), Thursday (48v), Friday (61v), Sunday (69v). Mala is on . F-81r: Prayer of the Covenant, Ṣälotä Kidan, ጸሎተ፡ ኪዳን፡. As part of the liturgy, the prayer has been copied and printed many times, e.g. MQ 256 –62; MD 602 –14; see also DChr 46 –50; Me‘erāf I 1 –6 and II, 170 –4; EurChr; and Liturgy 314 –21. F-86r: Mystagogia, Tǝmhǝrtä Ḫǝbu‘at, ትምህርተ፡ ኅቡዓት፡. HTexte 48–72; Textes 40–52; Me‘erāf I 215–7; MG 9ff. F-89r: God of the Luminaries, እግዚአብሔር፡ ዘብርሃናት፡. Répertoire 363; EMML 4001 (10: 1); and Princeton Ethiopic 13, f–46r. See also EA 2: 249; and Säbattu Kidanat, Qəddase Maryam, Mälkə’a Guba’e (Addis Ababa: Täsfa, 1959 E.C.) 38ff. Incipit : እግዚአብሔር፡ ዘብርሃናት፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ዘሥልጣናት፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ዘአርእስተ፡ መላእክት፡ . . . F-91r: Prayer, “For the sake of peaceful holy things,”Bä’ǝntä Qǝdsat, በእንተ፡ ቅድሳት፡ ሰላማዊት፡. MQ 26 –9; MG 41ff.; Liturgy 33 –7. F-97v: Anaphora of Our Lord, ቅዳሴ፡ እግዚእ፡. See Mercer. F-113r: Anaphora of Our Lady Mary attributed to Cyriacus of Bəhənsa, Qǝddase Maryam Gwäs’a, ቅዳሴ፡ ማርያም፡. F-116r: Unidentified work in which the writer addresses Adam with prophecies of future salvation, etc., and of Saint Gorgorios' teaching concerning the seventh day as the symbol of trinity, unity, and salvation. F, 75r, and passim, mention the owner, ገብረ ኪዳን.

origin.origDate: 1854-1861. F. 89v mentions Archbishop Cyril (IV, 1854-1861) and Bishop Abba Salama (III, 1841-1867)
